title: Leading causes of death among black U.S. residents in 2017
yAxis: Percentage of all causes of death
summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
There is a difference of 21.3 between the maximum Month Diseases of the heart and minimum Month Septicemia.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of all causes of death for 10 number of Months.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
There is a difference of 21.3 between the maximum Month Diseases of the heart and minimum Month Septicemia.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
Month Diseases of the heart has the highest Percentage of all causes of death and Septicemia has the lowest Percentage of all causes of death.
Second maximum Percentage of all causes of death is found at Month .
The difference of Percentage of all causes of death between the highest and lowest Month is 21.3.
Percentage of all causes of death at Month Diseases of the heart is 23.3 , second place is  at 23.3, and thirdly is Accidents (unintentional injuries) at 5.9.
Over the past 10 Months, the Percentage of all causes of death has decreased.
The average Percentage of all causes of death in all 10 Months is 7.39.
The Percentage of all causes of death is 73.9 if we add up values of all Months.

data.Month: Nephritis nephrotic syndrome and nephrosis (kidney diseases)
